Legal_Issue: Whether the officer erred in law by applying an incorrect test to assess the best interests of the children
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 25(1)
Legal_Rule: Officers must consider the best interests of children without applying thresholds such as 'unusual or disproportionate hardship'
Procedural_Issue: Officer applied an incorrect legal test
Grounds_for_Claim: Improper assessment of children's best interests
Outcome_on_Merits: Application initially dismissed; decision found unreasonable
Legal_Framework: Humanitarian and Compassionate grounds under IRPA
Applicant_Challenge: Officer minimized hardships and failed to properly weigh factors
Court_Result: Judicial review allowed; case remitted for redetermination
Outcome: Remitted for reconsideration by a different officer
Governing_Rule: Best interests of the child must be central and assessed without improper thresholds
